dataIdInfo.idAbs: Utilizing a user digitized and parameterized vector layer, derive a forward model of the likely thorium distirbution utilizing kappan smoothing.

tool.name: ThoriumModel_Once

param.name: thorium_raster
param.dialogReference: The input raster data set containing observed thorium abundances.

param.name: in_features
param.dialogReference: A vector dataset with one or more fields containing an estimated abundance per unit.

param.name: abundance
param.dialogReference: The field, from the input features raster, that will be used to assign a cell value.

param.name: fill
param.dialogReference: The fill value, used, when no data is available for a given cell. This value is used when unassigned 'slivers' exist in the input vector layer.

param.name: sigma
param.dialogReference: The radius to which the kappa function is applied. In kilometers.

param.name: finite
param.dialogReference: Controls the behaviour of the kappe function. If true, only finite cell values are utilized in the computation. If false (unchecked) only cell values greater than 0 are considered.

param.name: resolution
param.dialogReference: The analysis resolution, computes as thorium_model_resolution * (1 / resolution). For example, a value of 8, creates an analysis raster with 64 cells (8 x 8) for every thorium cell.

tool.summary: Utilizing a user digitized and parameterized vector layer, derive a forward model of the likely thorium distirbution utilizing kappan smoothing.
